file_summary: This XML file serves as a Checkstyle configuration, defining which checks are enabled and how they operate. It configures the main `Checker` module to include the `io.spring.nohttp.checkstyle.check.NoHttpCheck`, which is likely responsible for enforcing rules related to the absence of HTTP in specific contexts (e.g., preventing hardcoded HTTP URLs). Additionally, it integrates a `SuppressionFilter` module, directing Checkstyle to load suppression rules from an external file named `nohttp-checkstyle-suppressions.xml`. This setup allows developers to define a set of HTTP-related code quality rules and then specify exceptions to those rules in a separate, dedicated suppression file, providing flexibility in code analysis.
